issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: FTPFileSystem sets the host from the path supplied during creation which can cause issues in all the subsequent calls if path is incorrect

comments.body: I see the class name being {{com.suning.cybertron.superion.util.FSDownload}} which is not same as FSDownload in Hadoop distribution. Is the code same ?
This looks like an issue with {{FTPFileSystem}} implementation. It should not be setting the configuration in {{initialize()}}.
Ok...I have moved the issue to HADOOP common from YARN and also updated the issue. You can change the description. This would need a fix in {{FTPFileSystem}}.

GitHub user RebornHuan opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/236

    HADOOP-12084: revise multiple FTPFileSystem issue  

    revise multiple FTPFileSystem issue  when using filesystem CACHE.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/RebornHuan/hadoop trunk

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/236.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #236
    
----
commit e205bfe6c6e624a0179f25672474e72d6f9a9095
